name: Clean Air & Water
title: EPA Plans to Restore Policy Preventing ‘Second Guessing’ of Emissions Estimates for NSR Permitting
description: In support of the administration’s efforts to facilitate the development of data centers, on September 15, 2025, US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Administrator Lee Zeldin announced at a White House artificial intelligence roundtable that the agency plans to readopt a 2017 memo issued by former EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt (the Pruitt Memo) concerning the Clean Air Act's New Source Review (NSR) permitting program. The Pruitt Memo, which was rescinded by the Biden administration in 2022, provided that EPA would not “second-guess” pre-project emissions projections made by permit applicants and/or state permit writers, providing applicants and state permitting agencies increased latitude in determining whether certain projects triggered NSR requirements.
